metadata.Title: CVE-2023-37920 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description: Certifi is a curated collection of Root Certificates for validating the trustworthiness of SSL certificates while verifying the identity of TLS hosts. Certifi prior to version 2023.07.22 recognizes "e-Tugra" root certificates. e-Tugra's root certificates were subject to an investigation prompted by reporting of security issues in their systems. Certifi 2023.07.22 removes root certificates from "e-Tugra" from the root store.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> the python-pip package bundles python-certifi binaries when built. After updating python-certifi, a no-change rebuild of python-pip is required. sbeattie> python-certifi in Debian and Ubuntu is patched to use the system CA certificates

criterions.comment: python-certifi package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
python-pip package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
